entries.meaning: (physics, chemistry) Of or relating to atoms; composed of atoms; monatomic.
examples: A stream of atomic hydrogen is emitted.

entries.meaning: Employing or relating to nuclear energy or processes.
examples: We built a small atomic bomb in the garage.
The hairs on a bedbug are almost atomic.

definitionGroups.group: Unable to be split or made any smaller.

entries.meaning: (programming, of a commit in a VCS) Containing a single change, as opposed to involving numerous unrelated changes.
(logic, of a proposition) Lacking logical operators; unable to be made simpler in logical form.
(computing, of an operation) Guaranteed to complete either fully or not at all while waiting in a pause, and running synchronously when called by multiple asynchronous threads.
examples: In order to avoid race conditions, this operation has to be atomic.
Whenever possible, use atomic types instead of mutexes.
